intro: Sphenodesme stellata, commonly known as the star-stemmed sphenodesme, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are usually alternate, pinnately divided, and have a distinctive aromatic scent. Sphenodesme stellata is often found in the southeastern United States, where it thrives in rich, organic soils.
